title: Resurfacing at busy Portwood roundabout latest roadworks to hit that area of Stockport
text:
Resurfacing at busy Portwood roundabout latest roadworks to hit that area of Stockport Month-long project will see lanes and M60 sliproad closed for eight and half hours overnight Share The Portwood roundabout. Image from Google Streetview Share   
Lanes on the busy Portwood roundabout and the M60 sliproad will be shut as yet another set of roadworks hits that area of Stockport . 
Council contractors will be resurfacing the road over a period that will last four weeks at least until March 13. 
In a bid to minimise disruption the work - which will see traffic restrictions while it is being carried out - is scheduled to take place 9pm to 5.30am each day. 
A council spokesman said: “It will be necessary to restrict traffic movements utilising temporary lane closures on the roundabout and associated road closures. Read More 
“These will be on Carrington Road, St Mary’s Way, Great Portwood Street, and M60 exit/entry points on various nights. 
“During working times a signed diversion route will be in operation. 
“Work is scheduled to take four weeks to complete, weather permitting.” 
At the same time, as part of the ongoing £73 million Town Centre Access Plan (TCAP), United Utilities workers will be at Newbridge Lane, Portwood. 
They appeared on site on February 6 and are expected to be there for three weeks while utility services are diverted. 
For this period there will be a one-way restriction on the road, from the junctions with St Mary’s Way and Alpine Road, affecting motorists heading towards Stockport town centre. 
Traffic in this direction will be subject to a diversion via St Mary’s Way, Great Portwood Street, Corporation Street and Millgate. 
Other long-running roadworks are taking place to widen St Mary’s Way, which are also part of the TCAP - a council scheme to ease traffic congestion and promote sustainable forms of transport. 
And one of the main approach roads to Portwood and the town centre, Stockport Road West and East in Bredbury , is currently being resurfaced. Read More Max Power 'car cruisers' are set to be BANNED from two car parks - and anyone turning up could be fined 
This will continue with temporary lights until early March from Lyndhurst Avenue to Lower Bents Lane. 
Working hours, during which the Broadway will be closed, are Monday to Saturday 7.30pm to 5.30am and Sunday 5pm to 5.30pm. 
One Portwood resident said: “The main problem during morning and evening rush hour is the extra lane they are putting on St Mary’s Way.
